title: Countries with the fastest growing economies from 2001 to 2010
yAxis: Annual average GDP growth in percent
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Annual average GDP growth in percent in the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is appeared to be the highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
The highest Country Angola has 3.5 more Annual average GDP growth in percent than the lowest Country Rwanda.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.
The maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent 11.1 is found at Country Angola and the minimum is found at Rwanda where Country is 7.6.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Annual average GDP growth in percent in the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is appeared to be the highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
The highest Country Angola has 3.5 more Annual average GDP growth in percent than the lowest Country Rwanda.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.
Country Angola has the highest Annual average GDP growth in percent and Rwanda has the lowest Annual average GDP growth in percent.
Second maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent is found at Country China.
The difference of Annual average GDP growth in percent between the highest and lowest Country is 3.5.
Country Angola is higher than any other Countrys with value 11.1, followed by China, and Myanmar. Down to Country Rwanda with the lowest value 7.6.
Similar Annual average GDP growth in percent is found in Country Chad, and Mozambique.
The Country Rwanda tends to be 1.25 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 88.5.
